page.title: 20POPULATION
page.content: About half of the people in this area are families who have lived in the area for a long time. Others have moved into the area because they have chosen to live in the country. The small farms on the hill have enough land for people to keep horses, and when the houses are modernised they are attractive to town people. People are able to travel to Kidderminster and Birmingham to work. The usual number of children in a family is two. There are many houses which are occupied by retired people, some who have previouly worked in the area. In Cleeton St Mary there are four almshouses for elderly people, who have lived in the parishes of Cleeton or Nash. .
